Neuroscience.structures.Excitatory_Neuron¶

class Neuroscience.structures.Excitatory_Neuron.Excitatory_Neuron(res, inputs, outputs, instance_count='')[source]¶

Bases: Neuroscience.structures.Abstract_Neuron.Abstract_Neuron

A class representing an excitatory neuron in a neural network.

The Excitatory_Neuron class inherits from Abstract_Neuron and is used to simulate the behavior of neurons that primarily activate other neurons (excitatory neurons). This class includes specific methods for printing neuron details, setting axon terminals, and propagating outputs to connected neurons.

type¶

The type of the neuron, initialized as “Excitatory”.

Type

str

name¶

The name of the neuron, initialized as “Excitatory_Neuron”.

Type

str

print()[source]¶

Prints details about the excitatory neuron, including its name, number of dendrites, and axon terminals.

propagate_outputs()[source]¶

Propagates outputs to connected neurons based on the neuron’s current state.

If the neuron has reached its maximum active potential, it sends a signal (value of 1) to all connected neurons. Otherwise, it sends a signal of 0.

set_axon_terminals()[source]¶

Activates all axon terminals of the neuron.

This method turns on all axon terminals, indicating that the neuron is actively transmitting signals.
